result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Tara L. Reamer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Practitioner Prescribe Drugs/Own Use, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.38(5).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The defendant shall not commit any criminal offenses; shall notify the Taylor County District Attorney's Office, as well as the Clerk of Court's office, of any change of address within ten days of said change.  Defendant shall write a letter of apology to Aspirus Medford Hospital.  Letter must be submitted to and preapproved by the Taylor County Victim/Witness Coordinator.
Defendant must undergo an AODA and all recommended follow through treatment.

judgments.dispoDesc: Pursuant to an agreement and on motion of the State, the Court granted a deferred entry of judgment for a period of three years.  Upon successful completion of the agreement, the State will move to dismiss the felony charge.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample.

Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall write a letter of apology to Aspirus Medford Hospital due within 30 days and preapproved by probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with any recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
The jail sentence shall begin no later than March 8, 2016 at 4:30 pm.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  
Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: In Court Notice to Defendant After Sentencing

Defendant Tara L. Reamer in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed.  Waive reading of information.  Victim rights complied.  Plea of no contest to counts 1, 3, 4 and 5.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Argument by counsel regarding jail sentence. Statement by Tara Reamer.   Court enters deferred entry of judgment on Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty of counts 3, 4 and 5. Counts 3, 4 and 5 court orders a withheld sentence probation for three years with conditions of court costs; DNA SC and sample; counseling as deemed appropriate, AODA; letter of apology to Aspirus Medford Hospital due within 30 days and preapproved by probation; six months county jail with huber to begin no later than March 8, 2016 at 4:30 pm.  Count 2 dismissed and read in.  - rt

Defendant Tara L. Reamer in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Written waiver of preliminary hearing filed.  Court questions defendant.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a crime was committed.  Information filed.  Waive reading of information.  Plea of not guilty to all charges.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 03:15 pm.  - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Tara L. Reamer in court with attorney Karl J. Kelz.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint.  Waive time limits for a preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 10:15 am.  - rt

ADR began at 2:07 p.m.  Defendant Tara L. Reamer in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint.    Defendant would like an attorney. Court ordered $1,000.00 signature bond; booking and no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.   Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 01:00 pm.   ADR ended at 2:11 p.m.  - rt

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
